no title

CURRICULUM VITAE

Name: Mahesh Reddy

IT professional with 10+ years experience, including consultancy, across multiple and varied projects in the IT industry in Commercial/Retail, Telecoms, Health and Insurance sectors.

Skills

Supreme communication skills with proven ability to work closely with all levels of customers/clients/users, colleagues and business teams.

Structured, organised and meticulous approach to work with prioritised progression of daily duties.

Pro-active, efficient and take total ownership of allocated responsibilities.

Work to target times/deadlines and budgets whilst achieving required goals.

Enjoy working in varied roles with elements of business analysis, project management, stakeholder and business relationship management as well as end-user coordination.

Tools

Go to highlighted section .

Memberships a

The Chartered Institute for IT (BCS)

Prince 2 Practitioners

FIAP Fellow of Institute of Analysts & Programmers

 

​ Employment History

Business Analyst - Leading by Design Transformation Programme

April 2011 to date – Hertfordshire Partnership NHS Foundation Trust (HPT)

Hertfordshire Partnership NHS Foundation Trust has a commitment to become a leading provider of mental health and learning disability specialist care. The Leading by Design (LbD) Transformation Programme is part of the work towards achieving this commitment. LbD is a million pound programme made up of several programmes with a number of projects which equally have a number of workstreams within them. I have been involved in the Informatics programme which has 4 projects linked to it;

Replacement of the existing electronic patient record CareNotes

CAAS, Service User telephone triage system

Mobile flexible working for staff

Business Intelligence

Services assigned to me include:

Inpatient Services

Acute Services

Day Care Services

Residential Care Services

Forensic Services

Community Health Care Services

My role involves:

Gathering information in categories running across all 4 Informatics projects through one to one and group meetings with staff.

Managing stakeholders within the services assigned to me.

Mapping As-Is processes for all services assigned to me.

Capturing and reviewing issues and risks relating to the services provided.

Communicating any issues, risks and other important matters to senior management.

Facilitating stakeholder workshops

Liaising with team members/colleagues looking after other areas where there are touch-points or cross-overs.

General business analysis tasks

Lead Business Analyst for Dental Programme

December 2010 to April 2011 - Guys & St Thomas’ NHS Trust (GSTT)

Guy’s & St Thomas’ has a Dental Hospital which is part of the Dental Institute that brings together Guy's and St Thomas' Foundation Trust and Kings College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust and Kings College London. The Dental School provides undergraduate and postgraduate training for dental students as well as training for other Dental professionals such as Hygienists and Dental Nurses in the 13 Dental Services sub specialties:

Oral Medicine, Oral Pathology, Oral Microbiology and Oral Immunology 

Oral Surgery

Orthodontics

Paediatric Dentistry 

Sedation and Special Care

Periodontology

Fixed and Removable Prosthodontics including laboratories

Dental Radiology 

Acute (Primary) Dental Care 

Conservative Dentistry 

Restorative Dentistry 

Endodontics 

Dental Implants 

And the Dental Polyclinic which carries out all treatments (1 to 13)

Responsibilities

Dental Services is in the process of implementing a Dental system called SALUD (by TTH). As part of the preparation for implementation and the Service having identified the need for a reference document for Dental Services, I was asked produce a ‘Book of Dental’ to include Dental Department information and maps (where applicable) as a main task for this role. The information to be collected, collated and delivered as the said document (Book of Dental) includes:

Staff resource and numbers including students and professionals training in the Dental Services.

Dental equipment resource.

Dental sub specialty clinics and the patient pathway including outcomes.

Dental Admin processes including referral and appointment system and process.

Dental individual treatment processes.

Dental systems (manual and electronic).

Dental Services interactions and joint clinics with other departments.

Issues and risks within Dental Services.

Any other information relevant to Dental Services.

Other tasks include

Producing an interface document for all potential system interfaces that would be required by Dental Services.

General business analysis tasks.

Senior Business Analyst - Consultancy

November 2010 to March 2011 (and adhoc to Date) – National End of Life Care Intelligence Network, NHS

The NEoLFCIN has a main requirement of implementing a national repository solution for the collection of end of life care information for analyses and research purposes. There are a number of systems that already collect majority of the information but work independent of each other therefore bringing limited benefits to existing processes, service delivery and end of life care as a whole.

Responsibilities

This is a basic short very term role involving:

Meeting with senior professionals, members of the NEoLC Repository Working Group to elicit requirements.

Gathering of business and information requirements for the proposed repository solution.

Producing a business and information requirements specification document.

Liaising with the Programme Manager for NEoLCN on high level requirements of the next stages of the project.

Lead Business Analyst, Business

December 2009 to October 2010 – Skills Profile (a part of iProfile)

A Skills for Health project commissioned to Skills Profile by the four Chief Nurses of the United Kingdom. This project is for the initial work towards the provision of a nationwide Skills Passport for Health (portable, transferable, verified record) of an individual’s education, qualification and training for healthcare professionals (NHS and private).

Responsibilities

My job involves leading and mentoring a team of business analysts in carrying out the analysis, and design work through the initial phase and entire development lifecycle of a .net based system in an Agile, Scrum environment. This involves working with varied external stakeholders such as Skills for Health, HR/Workforce, Education Learning & Development Training teams/departments in selected Trusts.

Introducing the skills passport concept to healthcare (NHS) trusts and organisations via the HR/Workforce (including Staff Bank), education, training (Statutory & Mandatory, skills and competency) and development (CPD/PDP) departments as well as capturing their views and documenting them.

Interviewing clinical and non clinical members of staff such as Nursing, HR/Workforce, education and development training teams regarding their processes and staff information systems supporting the processes e.g. ESR (Oracle based), OLM (Oracle based), NLMS (Oracle based), EKSF, IAT (Oracle based), CRB, local systems etc.

Capturing, mapping, documenting and reviewing the department’s current processes (with reviews by the departments).

Capturing issues in HR/Workforce, training and development processes and evaluating associated lost costs.

Identifying risks related to the processes and potential related costs.

Analysing the time and cost impact of the administrative burden in the HR/Workforce and training processes.

Analysing problems and bottlenecks in the recruitment and training processes with a view to draw benefits to be realised from the adoption of the skills passport.

Obtaining and evaluating numbers of HR/Workforce/Staff Bank staff, trust/organisation staff (including Staff Bank staff), starters, leavers and movers, as well as training numbers such as staff trained, DNAs, staff cover (Bank, agency or other), courses (Statutory & Mandatory, skills and competency) delivered, trainer (internal and external) numbers etc.

Quantifying and documenting benefits that can be realised from adoption of the skills passport for each individual trust/organisation and for the national case for mass adoption.

Identifying and reviewing content and function of other existing passports e.g. NHS Education South Central - Mandatory & Statutory Skills and Competence Framework and Passport, London Procurement – Training Passport, NHS Staff Passport , St George’s patient passport etc.

Relaying and discussing benefits with key senior staff members of the departments and getting confirmation of the said benefits.

Investigating department, trust/organisation, NHS, DoH, other healthcare staff regulatory, monitoring and guidance body recruitment and training policies, guidance and standards.

Investigating and documenting department, trust/organisation, NHS, DoH, other healthcare staff regulatory, monitoring and guidance body future plans and assessing how the skills passport would fit in and what benefits would be realised.

Investigating HR and training staff information systems (including manual paper based), IT infrastructure and analysing data collected with a view to identify what data will need to be collected from which system for the skills passport.

Reviewing change management required during transition to skills passport for both departments and clinical staff.

Producing documentation and related diagrams for the National Strategy Board meetings.

Producing business cases and summary and statements of work for each individual trust/organisation and collating review comments from trust/organisation HR and training Directors/Deputy Directors.

Working with the team to draft skills passport roll out adoption and implementation plans.

Designing screens and preparing documentation (interface and technical requirements specs) for integration of the skills passport and other relevant systems e.g. ESR, OLM, eKSF, Intrepid etc including relevant APIs.

Prototyping and designing the Skills Passport workflows from different user perspectives.

Data mapping, creating and documenting business rules for responses and reactions to commands of the Skills Passport system.

Building storyboards using screen flows of the recruitment and training processes, from the actor’s perspective.

Creating wireframes for workflows, information and data flows.

Building a prototype of the skills passport for presentation to stakeholders.

Planning and preparing documentation for Agile implementation.

Co-ordinating and participating in pre and post implementation reviews.

Delegating to other business analysts in the team and ensuring key targets are being met according to the project plan.

Building relationships and general continuous liaison with key stakeholders and senior management teams of the trust/organisation departments and their teams.

Liaising with the project manager(s) regarding milestones at the end of each sprint and project related work.

Keeping abreast of healthcare professional related training, skills and competency policies, improvement programmes and initiatives.

Lead Business Analyst

October 2006 to October 2009 – Guy’s & St Thomas’ NHS Trust (GSTT)

Guys & St Thomas NHS Trust runs the Guys Hospital and St Thomas’s Hospital which are major teaching hospitals as well as the Evelina Children’s Hospital. The three hospitals provide patient care to more than half a million patients in A&E, Acute and Specialist services and also offer a full range of hospital services to Lambeth, Southwark and Lewisham. The Trust also has joint care services with Kings Hospital.

Responsibilities

My job involved carrying out numerous pieces of analyses for various projects (see Projects). My role also had an element of Project and Business Relationship Management and involved interaction with varied pieces of software/systems (see ) in both clinical and non clinical areas facilitated by liaison and engagement with clinical professional staff, non clinical staff as well as non Trust individual or groups at all levels.

Carrying out feasibility studies or initial analyses.

Preparing Business Cases, Overview and Approach documents (with recommendations where required)

Carrying out clinical and non clinical staff interviews on patient pathways and supporting workflows.

Mapping work processes and producing:

process maps using Visio (Microsoft Office tool) of workflows, systems and patient pathways

process documents relating to the mapped patient and systems processes (both ‘As Is’ and ‘To Be’)

Requirements elicitation through single and group interviews.

Gathering, collating captured requirements and producing business requirements specification documentation.

Carrying out gap analyses where required.

Capturing information risk and other information directly related to the project or solution.

Updating current Business Analysis work plans.

Liaising with relevant groups within the Trust and outside the trust on the allocated work.

Advising relevant groups on issues/risks and other matters relating to the project where required.

Meeting with stakeholders for updates and further requirements as well as generally communicating information.

Researching available and suitable solutions based on requirements and ensuring they are compatible with the existing infrastructural framework as well as other systems they may have to interface or integrate with.

Meeting suppliers for solution presentations and discussions around system functionality and requirements associated with supply of a solution.

Liaising and chasing suppliers for implementation costs (quotes), timescales and dates.

Ensuring recommended or preferred option costs (including implementation, training, support and other relevant) fall within the allocated budget.

Working with and liaising with the Business Relationship Managers as required.

Lead Business Analyst

August 2006 to October 2006 - Harvey Nash, Mayfair, London

Harvey Nash is a global professional recruitment consultancy and IT outsourcing service provider with a large portfolio of blue chip national and international companies. My responsibility was to look after 2 of Harvey Nash’s valued clients, Legal & General (L&G) and VANCO.

Legal &General (L&G), General Insurance (GI) - Legal & General (L&G) is one of the largest insurance providers in the UK. Its portfolio is significant and covers a large proportion of the life and non-life insurance market.

Responsibilities

My job involved the capture the complete software requirements for Legal & General’s Delegated Authority with a view to automate appropriate parts of the process of delegating authority.

Creating the Terms of Reference document, managing the internal and client review and eventually client approval for the project to proceed.

Arranging and having meetings with L&G staff to map out their delegated authority current/existing processes.

Identifying the areas that should be automated from the mapped processes.

Gathering requirements for an automated delegated authority process.

Preparing Software Requirement Specification and use case documents.

Creating Visio design diagrams of the delegated authority current processes for the creation of the prototype by the off shore team.

Managing reviews (both internal and external) updating the documents as required.

VANCO, Global Virtual Network Operator - VANCO is a virtual network service provider that provides network services to enterprise customers, carriers and also provides IT Integration and outsourcing services.

Responsibilities

My job involved working with the offshore teams in adding functionality to an existing Oracle (J D Edwards ) based sales support portal by bringing together pricing databases from 300 telecoms suppliers.

Discussing and reviewing requested changes with relevant stakeholders.

Reviewing new change requests to ensure they have not been duplicated and prioritising the change requests accordingly.

Ensuring the requests fall within documented functional requirements.

Logging the change requests on the Beaver Change Request Database and raising the relevant documentation.

Creating designs and use cases as part of the change request documentation.

Attending project board meetings to seek authorisation to process change requests.

Business Analyst

November 2005 to August 2006 - BT Health (NPfIT)

BT Health is one of the largest providers of IT services to the NHS, assisting in building NHS professionals, patient and other communication networks in order to improve delivery of better healthcare services.

Responsibilities

Working with designated stakeholders to analyse and document requirements to gain stakeholder support for the solution and ensuring BT contracted commitments are delivered.

Undertaking Requirements Analysis, carrying out research, gathering and collating requirements.

Liaising with to be users to capture requirements and presenting findings.

Keeping abreast of migration and deployment plans and analysing how some requirements may impact these areas.

Reviewing impact assessments, functional specifications and supplier requirement documents.

Preparing use cases and requirement documents as well making updates.

Taking responsibility for having use cases, requirement documents and other documentation reviewed and approved where required.

Working with the supplier in the development of requirement specifications for input to the development of the solution.

Analysing sensitive, restrictive requirements from the user role and responsibilities (RBAC) perspective in aid of determining practicality.

Representing BT and the Care Management workstream at presentations, meetings, workshops and supporting the promotion of benefits and uses of the solution.

Creating new and updating existing activity workflow maps, processes and process descriptions on Casewise.

Analysing Care Management individual processes via a Casewise matrix and looking at the system functionality to determine what category the processes fall in.

Taking responsibility for ensuring that all documents requiring CfH approval follow the internal and BT/PMO review and approval procedure.

Acting as internal reviewer and approver for Care Management workstream.

Logging gaps and issues for Care Management workstream and ensuring they are brought to the attention of the relevant management and/or teams.

Ensuring all changes to any documents relevant to the project are captured and recorded for traceability.

Maintaining a good understanding of NHS structures and policies that may affect as well as may be impacted on by requirements

Assimilating knowledge of complex business processes and IT systems whilst understanding of the aims of the NHS National Programme for IT.

Keeping aware of core NHS policy initiatives, NHS secondary information and how it supports the business needs of the NHS, DoH and other health agencies.

Business/Test Analyst

January to June 2005 - NHS Connecting for Health (NPfIT), South

The National Programme for IT is a multi billion 10 year programme being implemented by an assorted group of Local Service Providers (LSPs) working with the NHS to provide a common solution to improve patient care using a national Care Record System (CRS).

Responsibilities

Working as part of a team within the Southern Cluster Model Community office, ensuring that the Carecast system delivered the Best Practice process requirements as agreed by the NHS.

Taking the lead for the NHS in the Model Community testing of the Carecast screens, process/screen flows, and other components of the solution that fell within the Best Practice requirements in order to ensure required outputs are achieved.

Working in close liaison with the London Model Community office, CCA and IDX test teams in ensuring testing applications work to specifications and ensure that problem issues are identified, prioritised and resolved effectively.

Providing testing output to the Best Practice teams covering Best Practice and system testing in order to ensure the CRS solution meets the agreed programme quality standards.

Attending Use Case review meetings/workshops or reviewing via e-mail.

Creation and verification of test cases created from Use Cases and NHS provided scenarios.

Contributing to the review of suppliers' Test Plans and Specifications to ensure that the testing of end-to-end business processes is consistent across system boundaries.

Being in agreement with suppliers on test conditions to be covered to ensure accurate and thorough testing of the processes.

Working and liaising with the Best Practice Process Design Groups (BPPDG) on all aspects of testing to ensure Best Practice is incorporated in the design and development of all scripts and mainly CRS functions.

Ensuring testing of CRS Screens and process flows are as per clinical best practice/safety are a standard approach for all CRS functions and modules. 

Making decisions on the severity levels for all test issues ensuring reflection of Best Practice guidelines and contractual requirements.

Reviewing and validating test data to be used for testing and, where applicable, any rules to be used for the data so that information is consistently recognisable across system boundaries.

Reviewing the Integration Test Plan which incorporates test conditions, test scenarios and data requirements in order to meet quality standards and agreed outputs.

Reviewing and contributing to guidance, project plans and other documents.

Designing, development and quality assurance of Test Packs and Test data for testing of all areas of Best Practice processes.

Problem/issue logging, resolution and escalation to relevant teams e.g. Best Practice, Design, and Configuration etc.

Highlighting risks and issues in accordance with programme process to support effective management decision making.

Keeping abreast of new developments in process and software testing methods and industry good practice to ensure capable review of CCA and Trust issues.

​ Business Analyst

​ July 2004 to Dec 2005 – National Programme for IT, London Application/Business Analyst

Responsibilities

Working with Perot Systems and IDX in creating a standard CRS solution for the London and Southern Clusters and ensuring the system is designed and developed to achieve patient care support that is effective and efficient across each care setting.

Taking the lead for the NPfIT/NHS in the design, configuration, tailoring and development Carecast screens, specifying screen flows, maintaining tables associated with the patient care functions tables, and other components of the CRS solution.

Analysing and raising relevant comments on Workstream, PIDs, Process Design Flows, Use Cases and Review documents.

Projecting and managing the design and development of CRS modules in liaison with Capital Care Alliance (BT) and IDX and assisting the CRS Implementation Team as required.

Presenting the results to the BPPDG’s and NHS reviewers for review and Quality Assurance.

Liaising with Perot Care Redesign and Deployment Team on ‘As Is’ Processes

Providing the training team with assistance where required in the development of the training curriculum and maintenance/update of user manuals.

Providing Checkpoint reports to the Application Analyst Manager and periodic reports to the Implementation Project Team against milestones set for the various phases of the project.

Developing and maintaining a sound knowledge of current issues in the care professions and associated practices relating to the CRS modules.

Serving as the contact point with respect to the patient care elements/functions of CRS to suppliers and associated NHS Groups.

Supporting BPPDG Leads by facilitating workshops and meetings as and when required as well as undertaking the role of Scribe at Validation Sessions and other workshops.

Retaining a standard approach to the design and build effort and working closely with other Application and Configuration Analysts across modules/functions/workstreams to ensure the system meets the NHS CRS requirements as laid out in the Schedules of the CRS contract.

Attending Best Practice Process Design Workshops, System Validation Sessions, and Use Case Review Workshops, Workstream Care Core meetings, Application Analysts Team meetings, meetings with early adopters/implementer sites and meetings with Fujitsu Project Managers.

Updating the Issues Log, liaising/resolving issues with Workstreams and escalating issues where required.

2004 – Whipps Cross Hospital/Redbridge PCT - Business Analyst

2002 to 2004 - BT IGNITE, Project Support Datacleanse Analyst

2002 - DELOITTE & TOUCHE, Blackfriars - Helpdesk Analyst

2001 to 2002 - TESCO Stores Head Offices -Lead Support Co-ordinator

2001 - Global Tele Systems (GTS Esprit) - Customer Support Admin

2000 to 2001 - WorldCom - Helpdesk Supervisor

2000 – Ergonom – Customer Care Team Lead

1999 - 2000 - WorldxChange Communications - Customer Care & Helpdesk Analyst

​ Educational Qualifications

Currently self studying for a BCS (degree equivalent) IT PGD

Diploma in Business Management - Business Finance, Information Technology, Business Communication, Quantitative Methods, Marketing, Economics, Business Mathematics & Statistics

​ Tools

Software Applications MS Office 97/2000 Suite MS Project 2000-3 Desk Top Publishing Email Applications Outlook 2000-3 Lotus Notes Server Email Software Applications MS Exchange Lotus Domino Linux Operating Systems Novell Netware3 Novell Netware5 ODB Remote Access Systems PC Anywhere Citrix AD Administrator PAL Remote Access Tool Secure Dial Other bespoke systems e.g. Provide IP (BT) Service Management Tools Remedy Lotus Notes 4.6 Acclaim AS400 Test Director Caliber RM 2005 Heat Reporting Business Objects Project Mapping Casewise Visio 2002/2003 Enterprise Architect Methodologies Prince2 Foundation & Practitioner (Accredited) RUP with Unified Modelling Language (UML) Structured Systems Analysis and Design Methodology (SSADM) Agile Clinical/Admin/HR Proton Cerner Millennium Carecast Core Concepts Carecast Label Builder Carecast Screen Building Choose & Book Diabeta3 Clynisys EMIS Datix IPM Patient Management system Isoft ICM (EPR) Vision Clarity ESR (Oracle) OLM(Oracle) Product Based JD Edwards (Oracle based) Prototyping Tools Axure

GSTT - Projects

Clinical

Renal – Proton Replacement System

Diabetes, Endocrine & Lipids – Diabeta3 Replacement System

ACU (Assisted Conception Unit) – ACU Management System

GUM – Results Delivery System

Ophthalmology

Genetics – Feasibility & Approach for Migration to PIMS

Genetics – Cancer Genetics System

Therapies Services – Therapies Patient Management System

Included: Nutrition & Dietetics, Occupational Health, Physiotherapy, Psychology, Foot Health (Podiatry), Spiritual Health, Speech & Language, Social Services

Colposcopy – Colposcopy System (Replacement for Women’s Healthware System)

Cleft Services – Cleft Lip & Palate Management System

Lupus – Lupus & Lupus Related Disease Patient Management System

Medical Photography – Digital Asset Management System

Medical Physics – Asset Mgt System with Equipment Training & Maintenance

Mortuary & Bereavement - M&B, Pathology (including Post mortem) System

Electronic GP Outpatient Letters (including A&E, Radiology and Pathology)

18 Week Pathway mapping for:

ACU

Lithotripsy

Renal

Neurology

Paediatric Renal Paediatric Cardiology

Paediatric Neurology

Cleft Services

Non Clinical

Appointment Centre – ‘As Is’ Work Processes

Assurance – Assurance & Policy Management System

Security – Security System

Sharepoint - Content Management System

Information Governance – System Access Management

Incident Management – Upgrade of Datix System

​ Hobbies

Reading, travelling, listening to music, meeting people, swimming, organising and arranging parties/events walking, in and outdoor gardening..

​ References

Supplied on request

personality.text:
I have more than 2 years of Experience in IT industry with extensive experience in JAVA, CSS, JavaScript, Python, QlikView, Tableau, Microstrategy, iRise, MapRFS, Hive, Flume, Spark Mllib, MySQL and iRise. 
My current focus areas are Predictive analysis of Original Equipment Manufacturer, Predictive of Churn Analysis and Predictive Analysis on BITS.I have worked on various solutions like Estimation Tool for Interoperable Landscape (ETIL), Mobile Point of Service (mPOS), Real -Time Disruption Management for Utilities (RDMU), Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM).
I am currently working on algorithms like Random Forest and Decision Tree in predictive analysis for Churn Prediction which concerns Retail Industry. 
Future work would include Visualization of Churn Prediction Analysis in QlikView, Predictive Analysis of Customer Experience for Communication Service Provider, renovation of OEM and documenting the research of Decision Tree and Random Forest Algorithm. Finding fields applicable for new solutions and developing the same. Enhancing competencies and developing skills in new areas as well as building on the skills already attained.
